alert.note: Alert for Inland Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 03 at 3:59AM EDT until May 03 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...CRITICALLY LOW HUMIDITY WITH GUSTY WINDS AND HIGH ERC WILL RESULT IN ELEVATED FIRE DANGER TODAY... .Humidity values will fall below 35 percent for several hours this afternoon. Meanwhile, winds will become breezy in the afternoon and combine with the critical humidities and high ERC values in place to create an elevated fire danger. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WITH HIGH ERC VALUES FOR INLAND HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity with high ERC values, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM EDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Inland Hillsborough. * WINDS...Northwest around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 28 percent. * ERC...Around 27. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
